melting.nearestNeighborModel
Class NearestNeighborMode

java.lang.Object
  melting.nearestNeighborModel.NearestNeighborMode
All Implemented Interfaces:
MeltingComputationMethod
public class NearestNeighborMode
extends java.lang.Object
implements MeltingComputationMethod

This class represents the nearest neighbor model. It implements the MelitngComputationMethod Interface

computesThermodynamics

public ThermoResult computesThermodynamics()
Description copied from interface: MeltingComputationMethod
This method is called to compute the melting temperature.

Specified by:
computesThermodynamics in interface MeltingComputationMethod
Returns:
ThermoResult containing the computed enthalpy, entropy and melting temperature.

isApplicable

public boolean isApplicable()
Description copied from interface: MeltingComputationMethod
This method is called to check that the options entered by the users are applicable with the used model (class).

Specified by:
isApplicable in interface MeltingComputationMethod
Returns:
false if at least one chosen option makes the model completely false. If one chosen option may lead to less reliable results, a warning message will appear. (ex : wrong hybridization type)

getPositionsPattern

private int[] getPositionsPattern(int pos1)
This method is called to determine the terminal position of a pattern (perfectly matching sequences or not perfectly matching sequences) from the position pos1 in the duplex

Parameters:
pos1 - : starting position of a pattern in the duplex.
Returns:
int [] which contains the positions of the pattern in the duplex. ('pos1' is the starting position of the pattern in the duplex)

getAppropriatePatternModel

private PatternComputationMethod getAppropriatePatternModel(int[] positions)
defines which method is appropriate to compute the energy of the pattern at the positions 'positions' in the duplex.

Parameters:
positions - : contains the positions of a pattern in the duplex
Returns:
the appropriate PatternComputationMethod to compute the energy of the pattern at the positions 'positions' in the duplex. If no appropriate PatternComputationMethod exists to compute the energy of the pattern at the positions 'positions' in the duplex, it returns null. If there is a terminal mismatch in the duplex, a SequenceException is thrown. If a nucleic acid is unknown, a SequenceException is thrown.

                                                  java.lang.String methodName)
initialises the PatternComputationMethod which represents the model 'methodName' entered with the option 'optionName'

Parameters:

methodName - : method or model name
Returns:
the initialised PatternComputationMethod.

checkIfMethodsAreApplicable

private boolean checkIfMethodsAreApplicable()
to check if all the necessary methods and models to compute the enthalpy, entropy and melting temperature of the duplex are applicable.

Returns:
true if all the necessary methods and models to compute the enthalpy, entropy and melting temperature of the duplex are applicable. If one necessary method or model doesn't exist, a NoExistingMethodException is thrown

analyzeSequence

private void analyzeSequence()
analyses the sequences. Check all the necessary methods and models to compute the enthalpy, entropy and melting temperature of the duplex are applicable. If one of the methods or models is not applicable, a MethodNotApplicableException is thrown.

computesHairpinTemperature

public static double computesHairpinTemperature(Environment environment)
computes the melting temperature of a hairpin loop (when there is more than 4 CNG repeats in a sequence)

Parameters:
environment -
Returns:
double melting temperature of a hairpin loop for the Environment 'environment'.

Returns:
